title: How to end my essay without saying in conclusion - Quora

response.answer_text: I mark university essays and I don’t have a problem with ‘in conclusion’, I actually like it because I know I’m finally at the end of the damned paper and I’ve got another 40 to mark! if you have been told not to write the phrase then I agree with the previous answer: state you argument again to start your concluding paragraph. ‘This essay has shown that cats are superior to dogs…’

You could end by stating the message you wish to pass across summarily. For example: “… Noise pollution is real and the sooner we tackle it, the better. Government regulation, public enlightenment are just some of the approaches we could take to curb…” Or you could end with a charge: “… It's time we take up our responsibilities and drop this lazy attitude of ours, bearing in mind that our future is at stake…”

Some of alternatives are here: ThereforeFinallyAbove allAll things consideredIn a wordBrieflyDo not forget to restate the main idea of your essay, or your thesis statement in concluding part of your essay. Make it short, but catchy as introduction and conclusion are the essential elements of writing to keep the attention of the reader.
